security_audit.summary: This is a documentation-only skill providing file header templates. It contains no executable code, no network access, no file system operations, and no external command execution. All 27 static findings are false positives caused by the analyzer misclassifying markdown code fences (containing backticks), GitHub URLs, and JSON field names as security-relevant patterns. This skill only displays documentation templates to help developers format file headers consistently.

content.value_statement: Inconsistent file headers make codebases hard to navigate and maintain. This skill provides standardized @input/@output/@pos comment templates for TypeScript, Python, and Shell files to document dependencies and purpose.
actual_capabilities: Provides templates for TypeScript/JavaScript file headers with @input/@output/@pos format
Provides templates for Python file headers using docstring format
Provides templates for Shell script headers with comment format
Excludes config files, stylesheets, and generated files from header requirements
Documents synchronization requirement with CLAUDE.md files
limitations: Only provides templates - does not automatically insert headers into files
Limited to three programming languages (TypeScript, Python, Shell)
No customization options for header format structure

best_practices: Always update headers when file dependencies or purpose changes
Sync file headers with directory-level CLAUDE.md documentation
anti_patterns: Copying headers without updating the specific details
Using vague descriptions like utility functions or helpers
Skipping headers for small files - consistency matters at all sizes

faq.question: Which files are exempt from headers?
faq.answer: Configuration files (JSON/YAML), stylesheets (CSS), generated files (*.d.ts), and node_modules are exempt.

faq.question: How does this integrate with CLAUDE.md?
faq.answer: The header includes a warning to sync changes with directory-level CLAUDE.md documentation for consistency.

faq.question: Can I customize the header format?
faq.answer: Currently the format is fixed to @input/@output/@pos structure for standardization across projects.

faq.question: Does this auto-insert headers?
faq.answer: No, it provides templates and guidelines. You manually apply them when creating or modifying files.

faq.question: What languages are supported?
faq.answer: TypeScript/JavaScript, Python, and Shell scripts have specific header templates provided.

faq.question: How does it work with fractal-docs-generator?
faq.answer: File-header-guardian handles individual file headers while fractal-docs-generator manages directory documentation.
